other_tests.findings: Best-corrected visual acuity of 20/160 in the right eye and 20/125 in the left. Pachymeter readings were 335 μm (right eye) and 330 μm (left eye). Advanced steepening of both corneas confirmed by topography. Light microscopy revealed attenuated endothelium and thickened Descemet's membrane with posterior nodularity.

Performed for visual rehabilitation of the left eye without complications. Histopathologic examination of the host button revealed thickened Descemet's membrane and abnormalities consistent with posterior polymorphous dystrophy.
Endothelium showed small diameter filaments staining positively for cytokeratin, with marked modifications.
Bilateral steepening of corneas; keratometry readings of 52.75 D axis 088 and 36.87 D axis 178 in the right eye, and 57.37 D axis 008 and 54.75 D axis 098 in the left eye.
Central corneal thickness was 335 μm in the right eye and 330 μm in the left eye.
